intro: Bombacopsis tocantina, commonly known as the Tocantins balsa, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, lowland areas. Its bark and leaves have been used traditionally for various purposes, including fiber and medicinal applications.
